intro: Mecranium multiflorum, commonly known as the many-flowered mecranium, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with hairy stems and palmate leaves. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
